test-suite.comment: Test suite for the ALMA-OT GUI (automated with QF-Test).
test-suite.author: Peter Kratzer

testcase.name: Version Info
testcase.qname: Version Info
testcase.comment: This test case's only purpose is to provide version information to the test reports (including HTML reports).
testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

comment.p: The existence of all major components (windows, menus, input fields etc.) is verified to determine GUI changes as well as component recognition issues at an early stage. Basic operations and settings of the OT are validated.
Supported telescope configurations: all.

testcase.name: Check Startup Options Dialog
testcase.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Startup Options Dialog

comment.p: Availability and components of the startup options dialog is verified.
Supported telescope configurations: all.

testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

teststep.name: Ensure Client Is Not Running
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Ensure Client Is Not Running

teststep.name: Startup Client
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Startup Client

teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Startup Options Dialog

teststep.name: Dismiss Startup Options Dialog
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Dismiss Startup Options Dialog

teststep.name: Shutdown Client
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Shutdown Client
teststep.comment: This step is required so that the following tests get the full startup with the required settings.

testcase.name: Check Presence Of Main Window Components
testcase.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Presence Of Main Window Components

comment.p: The main components of the main window are checked for presence so that their availability for further tests can be implied. Thus it is possible at an early stage to determine whether some components have been removed or renamed.
Supported telescope configurations: all.

testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

teststep.name: Check Main Window Existence
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Main Window Existence
teststep.comment: The main window holds all components of the GUI and is contained by the window frame provided by the window manager.

teststep.name: Check Menu Bar
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Menu Bar
teststep.comment: The menu bar contains the pull-down menus.

teststep.name: Check Additional Menu Bar
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Additional Menu Bar
teststep.comment: The additional menu bar is placed to the right (and right-adjusted) of the main menu. It displays the selected perspective.

teststep.name: Check Tool Bar
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Tool Bar
teststep.comment: The tool bar contains the icons for selected functions.

teststep.name: Check Work Display Existence
teststep.qname: Basic Windows, Panels And Components.Check Work Display Existence
teststep.comment: The work display is split into several sections containing the project structure tree view, editor, feedback and overview display.

teststep.comment: The "Calibration Time Estimate Tool" has been removed with ALMA release 10.0. This check verifies that the feature does not pop up again accidentally. However, this test is reliable only as long as the same menu item does not appear with a new/changed name attribute or in a different place.

testcase.name: Proposal In Data Base (Submit/Open)
testcase.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Proposal In Data Base (Submit/Open)

comment.p: The data base submission and open operations are checked.
Supported telescope configuration: all.

testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

teststep.name: Prepare Proposal
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Prepare Proposal
teststep.comment: A simple proposal is read from disk and adapted for this test (e.g. the required PI is set).

teststep.name: Submission Service Check And User Setup
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Submission Service Check And User Setup
teststep.comment: If the submission service is not available or fails due to missing authorisation an exception is thrown to terminate this test case.

teststep.name: Submit Proposal To DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Submit Proposal To DB
teststep.comment: The proposal prepared in the previous test step is submitted to the data base. The resulting information is written to a PDF file and the log to another file. The existence of both PDF and log files on disk is checked when the operation is completed.

teststep.name: Read Proposal From DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Read Proposal From DB
teststep.comment: The project code from the proposal created and submitted by the previous test steps is extracted. This project code is used to retrieve the submitted proposal from the data base. Before reading from the data base the proposal in memory in discarded. After reading from the data base the project code in the retrieved proposal is evaluated and compared with the original value as a basic check to determine whether the submission and open operations succeeded.

teststep.name: Resubmit Proposal To DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Resubmit Proposal To DB
teststep.comment: The previously created and in the previous test step loaded proposal is resubmitted to the data base with a changed title. Thus the stored proposal data in the DB is overwritten. The success of this operation is verified by reading the proposal from the DB again using the original project code and checking for the changed title.

testcase.name: Observable Lines

comment.p: Check observable lines in the spectral line selection dialog. For available ALMA bands all lines should be observable, for non-available bands (e.g. ESALMA, Cycle2 telescope configurations) no spectral lines should be observable. Implicitly, this test also verifies the telescope configuration, respectively the availability of frequency bands.
Supported telescope configuration: all.

testcase.name: Phase I Read-Only
testcase.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Phase I Read-Only

comment.p: The specified project with state after Phase1Submitted is loaded from the archive and the read-only state of all components in the proposal tab is checked.
Supported telescope configuration: CSVALMA.
This test case is not executed as part of the regression tests (i.e. when the global variable RegressionTest is set to true) since the required reliable preconditions cannot be guaranteed (yet).

This test case is supposed to be extended with an automated check for a list of projects in different relevant states. Currently this completion is pending the development of a tool to change state consistently for testing purposes.

testset.name: Positive Test For Science Goal - Field Setup - Source Coordinates Input
testset.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Positive Test For Science Goal - Field Setup - Source Coordinates Input

comment.p: Permitted values for field source coordinates are checked.
This test is structured as a test-set containing another test-set containing the final test-case due to restrictions of QF-Test regarding data driver handling.
This test set is executed only if the global variable BasicTestOnly is set to false.
Supported telescope configuration: all.

testset.author: Peter Kratzer

testset.name: Loop Over All Positive Values
testset.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase I Projects).Positive Test For Science Goal - Field Setup - Source Coordinates Input.Loop Over All Positive Values

comment.p: This test-set exists only for structural reasons imposed by QF-Test. It permits separating the loop over all positive values provided by the data driver while executing the setup (creation of a basic test project) only once at the beginning of the test.

Known issues:
* COMP-7508 ALMA-OT: Setting RA = 23:59:59.999 confuses display

Supported telescope configuration: all.

testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

teststep.name: Check Submission Service And Set Advanced User
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Check Submission Service And Set Advanced User
teststep.comment: If the submission service is not available or fails due to missing authorisation an exception is thrown to terminate this test case.

teststep.name: Open Programme Test File
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Open Programme Test File
teststep.comment: A programme on disk (provided with the test module) is opened.

teststep.name: Save Program To Disk
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Save Program To Disk
teststep.comment: The programme opened in the previous test step is saved as a new file to disk (into the working directory). The existence of the new file is checked. Then this file is deleted and created again by a simple save operation (in contrast to "save as" from the first step) . The existence of the resulting file is checked.

testcase.name: Program In Data Base (Submit/Open)
testcase.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Program In Data Base (Submit/Open)

comment.p: The data base submission and open operations are checked.
Supported telescope configuration: all.

testcase.author: Peter Kratzer

teststep.name: Prepare Program
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Prepare Program
teststep.comment: A simple program is read from disk and adapted for this test (e.g. the required PI is set).

teststep.name: Submission Service Check And User Setup
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Submission Service Check And User Setup
teststep.comment: If the submission service is not available or fails due to missing authorisation an exception is thrown to terminate this test case.

teststep.name: Submit Program To DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Submit Program To DB
teststep.comment: The program prepared in the previous test step is submitted to the data base. The resulting information is written to a PDF file and the log to another file. The existence of both PDF and log files on disk is checked when the operation is completed.

teststep.name: Read Program From DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Read Program From DB
teststep.comment: The project code from the program created and submitted by the previous test steps is extracted. This project code is used to retrieve the submitted program from the data base. Before reading from the data base the program in memory in discarded. After reading from the data base the project code in the retrieved program is evaluated and compared with the original value as a basic check to determine whether the submission and open operations succeeded.

teststep.name: Resubmit Program To DB
teststep.qname: Specific Dialogs And Functionality (Phase II Projects).Resubmit Program To DB
teststep.comment: The previously created and in the previous test step loaded program is resubmitted to the data base with a changed title. Thus the stored program data in the DB is overwritten. The success of this operation is verified by reading the program from the DB again using the original project code and checking for the changed title.

This test set is executed only if the global variable LargeNumberProjects is set to true and RegressionTest is set to false.
Supported telescope configuration: CSVALMA.
